title: Dreamliner comfort
text: Boarding was smooth and welcoming. Plenty of overhead locker space and a couple of pockets for books, devices and water bottle. USB charging. The seats were quiet comfortable for economy and good leg space. Refreshments were served soon after takeoff. An assortment of good wines and other beverages. The main meal was ok for airline food and plunger coffee was good, although I prefer mine stronger. Meals could be preordered online before the flight. No problem with coffee refill. A second alcoholic beverage was hard to get. Clean up was timely and efficient. Large tv screen and selection of recent release movies plus range of other entertainment. I would have liked subtitles available on more programs, this aspect was limited. Toilets were kept clean. For the money this was the best flight available for this destination.

title: Relaxed atmosphere child and dog friendly
text:
We dined on the deck but there are also tables inside. Great friendly service. Good range of cold beers. I also had a tasty cocktail. A variety of foods with predominately Mexican styles. Tacos heaped with filling and salad. Everything was fresh and tasty. Shrimp skewers , rice and flat tortilla dishes. The seafood tacos are great but the slow cooked pork was really good.
Easy to relax and enjoy

title: Iconic pier over the surf beach
text:
This pier is central to the town and its identity as a surf side spot. It's a must see if travelling in this area, just a short distance off the freeway to San Diego.
Stroll out and watch the surfers catch waves below you. I wish we had these at home on the Gold Coast.
Fishermen love the pier. Lots of sea birds.
Stop at the restaurant or bar, for drinks , coffee or enjoy the wonderful seafood.
Perfect to watch sunset.

title: Clam chowder over the surf on pier
text:
What a great setting on the deck looking down into the water and waves below.
We started with the clam chowder which is fantastic. Followed with a bucket of clams....
Plenty of cocktails available, but we had cold beer.
Plates of fresh fish and shrimp with side salads. Perfect seafood.
I recommend you stop here for lunch or dinner

title: A must see to experience life in a desert
text:
A unique environmental park in the desert lands of California. Beautiful rock formations and a Mecca for rock climbing.
We visited in June and the weather was warm to hot in the day and cool at night....perfect blue skies. It can get very hot later in summer. The information centre at the turnoff to the par in Joshua Tree has loads of maps and advice plus environmental information. Lots of camping sites but bring water and everything you need.
I will return to spend more time here.

title: Iconic western saloon bar
text:
This place is casual and has the atmosphere of a western saloon. Popular with the locals and visitors. Friendly staff and good cold drinks.
We had a variety of burgers which were fine but not really special. However, the ribs were great.
A local karaoke singer entertained us.....??
Worth a stop if you are visiting the area.

title: Convenient airport stay
text:
As well as being at the site for cruise ship departures and arrivals, Portside is very close to the airport terminals, 10 minutes in most traffic conditions.
The apartment we stayed in was fair price and further discounted by on line booking.com.
Very clean, fresh new appartments with everything you may need. Some great restaurants nearby as well as coffee and a variety of other service businesses.
We were very happy with our stay in this quiet riverside area.

title: Excellent Lebanese cuisine
text:
We stayed overnight at Portside to catch an early plane and dined on the harbour wharf area at Byblos.
It has a variety of Lebanese dishes.
Well presented meals with excellent table service. We choose the mixed grill for two. An assortment of dips with flat bread, followed by special pastry dishes...filled with tasty spiced fillings. Then lamb and chicken grilled skewers. It was very filling.
I recommend this restaurant if you are near the bot or air terminals.

title: Reliable travel
text: The return flight to Cairns was on schedule. Flight attendants were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was an egg and bacon muffin. A bit cold and tasteless but I guess they can’t cook onboard so ok but no real choice. I would have preferred fruit and yogurt. Afternoon tea was a tea cake with coffee. 0k. Legroom was good and seats comfortable. The entertainment was via the Qantas app which did not work on my ipad2. Also limited choice.

title: Relaxing tropical beach
text: Close to Cairns. Trinity Beach is a beautiful tropical beach with a safe patrolled beach. Perfect for walking and picnics. Covered picnic tables or walk down the beach to find a private place. Lots of cafes and restaurants to enjoy with ocean views.

title: Fabulous swimming in patrolled pool
text: Free public lagoon pool in central Cairns. Kids of all ages, as well as adults will love this. Tropical garden setting. Plenty of shade and nearby cafes and restaurants. Perfect place to cool off.

title: Excellent service great seafood
text: Situated on the ground floor at Pullman International. Relaxing restaurant with delicious menu. We really enjoyed the chefs seafood catch of the day. It was barramundi with interesting sauce and sides. Next day for lunch was a great Angus steak and salad. I recommend dining here and I will return

title: Relaxing tropical gardens water views
text: Excellent very helpful staff. Tropical gardens pool area was so relaxing on level 3. Spa sauna gym. Everything you need. Standard room with views across the water and boat marina. Large and clean. I would have given 5 stars except the rooms could use a refresh paint otherwise excellent.

title: No frills but ok and economical
text: For short flights like this I’m happy to fly Tigerair. Boarding experience was fine but we had a 20 minute delay which can happen on any flight no entertainment so take your own. Drinks and snacks were served efficiently but limited choice. Crew were friendly. Seats were not very comfortable and limited leg room but it was half the price of competition on this occasion.

title: Excellent views of Canberra
text: We drove up to the lookout to take some photos of Canberra and watch the sunset. Perfectly positioned to look over the War Museum across the vista to Parliament House. Many people had done the bush walk to the top. Signs inform you about the planning of this well planned city. Lots of birdlife including colourful crimson rosellas. The wallabies emerged as the sun set. A must see lookout.

title: Inked: Australian Cartoons
text: The Nation Library is a treasure of Australian history and more. This trip we visited Inked, an exhibition of Australian Cartoons. From the earliest satirical cartoons of the 1780’s to modern times. Poking fun at politicians and notable people, you can understand how people felt about events in history. I highly recommend a visit. Entry is free.

title: Views and atmosphere plus good coffee
text: After visiting the National Library we found comfortable outdoor seating at the Bookplate Cafe. Views of the lake on a warm perfect autumn day. The coffee was really good with a delicious selection of cakes to accompany it. The Italian ricotta cake was great.

title: The Antarctica Experience
text: The museum hosts a range of displays and activities. We thoroughly enjoyed the Antarctica Experience with Virtual Reality headsets. You felt like you were there with the penguins. You could swivel around and experience a 360 view. A short helicopter ride and look at life in the cabins. Also on display was Francis Birtle’s Bean which he drove from London to Melbourne

title: Salty soup
text: We ordered a chicken and an Asian greens soup. It was piping hot and needed tie to cool, ok for us but not if rushing to a flight. It was way to salty for me and quite chilli hot. The taste was overpowered by salt and an astringent acid spice. Not very enjoyable.

title: Fun and informative
text:
A must see collection of pioneer buildings, machines and experience of life in earlier times.
We were lucky to visit during the Easter festival as the place was full of activity and demonstrations eg blacksmith and wheelwright in action. The grand kids had a ride on the model steam train which they loved. Also had rides on the ponies. A huge collection of old machinery was fascinating. Many steam and other engines were working on display. Look at the web site and plan for a great day.

title: Beautiful Turkish food
text: Great friendly service. We were on a tight schedule to see a show and they found us a table and provided our meals surprisingly quickly. The food was delicious and expertly spiced. A mix of skewers from the charcoal grill with some dips. Well presented dishes as good as many that I’ve had in the Middle East. I highly recommend this popular restaurant.

title: Very ordinary food
text:
I just dropped in for a takeaway and ordered Singapore noodle.
I am very disappointed as it was dry and tasteless. I picked through the large serve but I couldn’t find anything interesting. Small shrimp some egg other unidentifiable things and a distinct lack of vegetables. I will throw out more than half. I cannot recommend this place

title: Best views of Lennox
text: A short drive or walk from Lennox Head town is this beautiful lookout on the headland. Unobstructed views of Lennox and southern beaches. Perfect to see the full moon rise over the ocean Popular spot for hang gliding enthusiasts.

title: Beautiful beach with patrolled areas
text: The is a great sandy beach stretching for miles. Excellent walk to the point and lookout. Clean fresh ocean water. Parks along the beachfront are perfect for picnics. Take care where you swim. There are patches of rocks in some areas. Best swimming is probably in the patrolled area.

title: Beachfront older style appartments
text:
Situated on the beachfront at Lennox Head with great access to shops restaurants and local hotel. It was hot humid weather for our visit and the appartment had no air conditioning and poor ventilation. The fans did little to help. Full kitchen facilities and lounge room. I found the bed uncomfortable.
Great for families with children- large lawn fronting the beach and playground in the park next door. I would not stay in the appartments near the road with unappealing views of the street and noise. The appartments facing the ocean looked good.

title: Great food suitable for large group
text: Wood fired pizza, pasta and more. We had a large group 20+ and they managed our orders well. Great standard of food and well presented. It’s best to book ahead for this busy place.

title: Must do this walk
text: The gorge walk is definitely worth it. Great views of ocean and beaches. Well defined path with hand rails but not suitable for wheelchair. Take your camera for some great shots. Waves crashing up the gorge.

title: Big seafood meals
text: A great location opposite the lookout at the point. The meals were served piping hot and generous served. The seafood basket could easily be shared between two. Excellent calamari. Basic seating. Not great Coopers ale, seemed a bit flat.

title: Big swimming hole and waterfall
text:
Just 2 kilometres from Maidenwell is Coomba falls and picnic area. Well maintained stairs from car park to swimming hole. Not suitable for wheelchair access. Great rock formations and natural riparian environment. Be careful swimming and heed the signs about no diving.
Great photo opportunities.

title: Beautiful little town and worth a stop
text:
Situated near the Bunya mountains this is a great rest place. The Trading Post has great coffee and food. Friendly people with good advice above the local area.
You will also find an incredible range of hand crafted sauces and condiments on display. There is a picnic area and pub across the road

title: Start your visit here
text:
A great place to start if you visit Kingaroy.
Kingaroy is a typical Queensland country town with a proud history associated with peanut production. The peanut processing factors offers tours but not every day so check at the visitor information centre.
Many great Queensland wooden homes are present and there was once a thriving timber industry.

title: Interesting site to sample history
text: The museum also incorporates the tourist information centre so it’s a great place to start your first visit to Kingaroy. The main focus is on agricultural history and early farming. Lots of old machines including early peanut thrashers. Helpful videos of peanut industry and early days. Interesting section on local soldiers from both world wars in full uniforms and collected items. Lots of other collectibles from past years.

title: Good coffee in comfort
text: Recently in Kingaroy for the day and looking for a good coffee. It was hot and we did a lap of the Main Street shops. Finally we found the Jamaica Blue at the Woolworths shopping mall. Air conditioned and comfortable seats Friendly efficient service. The coffee was really good with a great choice of sweets. Lots of people also enjoyed lunch there.

title: Fresh clean vegetarian food
text:
Friendly simple atmosphere. The menu is exclusively vegetarian both cooked and salads. Very reasonable prices.
Quick counter service. All meals are ready to serve. We had a selection of 4 cooked/salad dishes with rice for $14 each. Beautifully spiced but not hot. The Koftas balls were scrumptious as well as the vegetable curry.

title: Apartment on quiet Gold Coast beach
text:
Regency has direct beach access to a quiet area of Gold Coast beaches. Patrolled surf beach 50 m from pool and spa. Also short walk to patrolled swimming in Tallebudgera Creek opposite Burleigh Heads national park- great for children and families.
We had a one bedroom apartment that was fresh and clean with ocean views. Full kitchen and separate bathroom.
Good rate during the off-peak season.
We enjoyed our stay and will return again.

title: Safe surf beach
text: This is a beautiful sandy beach. It seems to be protected from northerly winds. Clear water. It has lifeguards and a flagged area. Well worth a visit when in Yamba

title: Great views average food
text: The views of Yamba beach and bay are fantastic What a great place to stop for lunch but the food was ordinary pub fare with full prices $16 burger was fresh but not tasty. Same with the Buffalo wings. Plenty of cold drinks

title: Best Thai in Yamba
text: Very friendly hosts and service. They buy fresh local seafood and feature this in the daily chefs specials. We had fabulous prawn dishes last night. Outdoor dining was perfect for a summer night. There are also indoor tables. I’d recommend this restaurant

title: Educational wildlife park.
text: Operating since the 1950s, this park is renowned for its wildlife conservation. The park is shaded by natural eucalyptus forest. A great variety of bird life is on display. Bird feeding show features raptors owls Brolga Pelican and more. Crocodiles are feed in the middle of he day. The children enjoyed the night animal house and platypus display

title: Best wildlife sanctuary for overseas guests
text:
Overseas visitors as well as residents can see and interact with a wide variety of iconic Australian wildlife. Time your visit to feed the wild lorikeets who visit in large numbers. Rare marsupials are on display: platypus, devils, wombats, kangaroos. Walk through large bird aviaries. See birds of play being fed. Be seated and enjoy the sheep shearing. Watch crocodiles being fed. So much to do. Fun for kids. Train ride.
I have visited many times over 60 years of living her and I’m always impressed

title: Close to beach and airport
text:
This is an older motel which has been refurbished. The room was clean and fresh but was small, just the double bed, small kitchenette and separate bathroom and new appliances. Friendly staff.
The beach is only 100m away and the motel is opposite the airport, so very convenient for travellers. The motel offers transfers to the airport.

title: Relaxed authentic Mediterranean food
text:
Our local friends took us for lunch as it is one of their favourite restaurants
There are outdoor shaded tables and indoor tables. The neighborhood was a quiet area
The food was excellent as well as table service.
I cannot forget the tastes and aroma of the food. See pictures
I recommend this restaurant

title: So much to explore in the old port city of Jaffa
text:
Alleys walkways and open spaces by the waterfront. We went at night on our first day in Tel Aviv. There is a vibrant nightlife and live music was being played in the square.
Loads of interesting restaurants of every international cuisine.
There is a viewpoint that offers wonderful views across the city and the sea. The night air was cool after a hot day.

title: Middle East grill
text:
Our friends took us to this beach restaurant in Jaffa. We enjoyed a delicious variety of salads and dips with fine wine before the grill arrived. Chicken beef and lamb skewers straight from the grill. Delicious spices on succulent meat. So colours and aromatic. Completed with sweets.
Great service and some staff spoke English. Moderate prices
Very popular clean restaurant

title: Significant prehistoric site
text: This is one of several significant prehistoric sites in Cyprus. Artefacts from 2000-3000bc have been located at the site of the Temple of Aphrodite. The small museum houses a number of these artefacts. Remnants of the original temple are still present as well as those from the Roman period

title: Authentic meze
text:
Kouklia is a beautiful traditional village just off the motorway near Aphrodite Hills.
We had a recommendation and it was excellent
Friendly helpful staff who catered for gluten free needs of one family member.
The meze has many delicious courses and I can recommend it.

title: Excellent theatre centre piece of Toowoomba
text:
The Empire Theatre has a long history in Toowoomba.
Restored in recent years to it’s former glory. It has been extended especially for theatre productions with huge behind stage facilities as well as annex and restaurant.
We have see live music and theatre here and always feel privileged with the excellent acoustic and proximity to the stage.
All seats get unobstructed views
Run by volunteers there is enormous civic pride for the Empire

title: The Blue Door great kebabs crepes
text: Easy to miss this gem as you walk into Pissouri square. Just a blue door and small kitchen but this place serves traditional kebabs. Antoni also cooks fabulous crepes. Cheap casual dining opposite the Iron Horse pub so you can grab a table have drinks and your kebab will be brought to you.

title: Great shopping
text:
Ledra street is the hub of the old city with streets and alleyways leading to all areas.
Start here if you wish to explore. Also a crossing point to the Turkish occupied part of Nicosia. Bring your passport if you wish to cross over.
Lots of old and modern shops. Plenty of eating places. We prefer to find some of the quieter restaurants in the side streets.
Viewing area on floor 11 of H&M building for Panorama and helpful exhibition of history of Nicosia including multi language video

title: My best coffee pick old Nicosia
text:
We have sampled many coffee shops in old Nicotine and this is my pick for best.
Excellent espresso. I also had an espresso fredo which I ordered with ice cream for a hot day. Most places can’t do this for you.
Friendly service and sweets. Close to my favourites cheap food place (Piatsa) andgift shop Cactus

title: Old fort at Pafos harbour
text:
Situated on the breakwater of the harbour this castle is a great photographic backdrop.
Entry is a small fee to climb up to the roof for even better views. Some interesting history and photos inside. Very similar to the other forts/castles in Limassol and Kollosis.

title: Panoramic views and great seafood
text:
Situated high above Saint George beach and boat harbour this restaurant offers magnificent views under a huge shaded roof. The seafood is delicious and fresh.
We had calamari and grilled fish, salads and dips. Good selection of gluten free. Friendly staff and clean restrooms.
Perfect for families, small and large groups.

title: Must see and enjoy a swim
text:
One of the top attractions in Cyprus and place of mythology regarding Aphrodite.
If you can visit when there is no wind to stir up the water you will enjoy swimming in crystal clear conditions.
Amazing smooth pebbles. Some footwear is advised. You can choose to enter on the shallow side to the east or straight into deep water on the west
Photographers love this place and often setup and wait for a sunset over the sea. In full moon it is fantastic.

title: Beautiful sheltered safe beach
text:
One of our favourite beaches lined with smooth pebbles. You can drive to either side of the Columbia resort to swim here. White sandy bottom and gradually gets deeper.
Enjoy this anytime of day. We particularly like visiting in the afternoon as you can find shady swimming spots. Lots of great cafes and restaurants on the eastern side.

title: Safe swimming and mile long beach
text:
We decided to cool off after visiting Limassol so we headed past the port to Lady’s Mile beach. It has Tavernas as well as uncrowded beaches. Perfect for children as you can walk out on white sand into the water which is shallow for 50-100 metres. Facing east so it is sheltered from the usual prevailing winds.
Popular with local families.

title: Best meze we have experienced
text:
Local friends in Nicosia took us to this restaurant which has been operating for years
I think I counted about 30 dishes which were delicious.
Bookings are advised as it is very popular

title: Excellent traditional souvlaki plus more
text:
This is a really cool and affordable cafe in a quiet corner near Lidras street. Excellent dips and some complimentary small dishes. We enjoyed the pork and lamb souvlaki with fresh salads. Friendly and helpful staff. I can recommend and we will return.
Prices were very reasonable

title: Cyprus night on Friday
text:
Cyprus night at this restaurant has traditional Cypriot dancing, balancing glasses on head act, belly dancing and finishes with popular music.
The food is a buffet of traditional dishes to help yourself as much as you wish.
Other nights is a la carte dining.
Bookings advised for Cyprus night.

title: Quality restaurant with traditional and a la carte meals
text:
Superb views across the bay on this full moon night. Refined dining at an affordable restaurant.
Bookings are advised as this is a very popular place. Friendly staff and service. I can recommend the oven baked dishes for lamb and pork. At our table we also enjoyed cannelloni, salmon and grilled lamb chops.

title: Relaxed cruise to the Blue Lagoon
text:
This is our recommendation for a boat trip from Latchi Cyprus around the Akamas peninsula to the Blue Lagoon. Crystal clear water for swimming and snorkeling.
We paid €50 for 4 people. A great deal. No extra costs for snorkeling for one hour. Free glass of wine and grapes.
Easy going friendly staff.
place: Alkion Glass Bottom Latchi Boat Cruises
